comments.body: Good point. Returning `any` is what lodash does with `_.get`, which is why I started using idx instead.

`test` can now take a function as message and it gets passes some data to use to compose an error message. The documentation around this is not all that defined and tracing through the code, I found properties that I listed in `TestMessageParams` but there could be more so I set the type as a union of `object` and the partial.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +78,82 @@        message:
            | string
            | ((params: object & Partial<TestMessageParams>) => string),
        test: (
            this: TestContext,

comments.body: Another addition, this basically lists out the properties that I found in the code.
Since test has both an config object style callsign and an arguments style callback, I also added the new changes to `message` here too.

Shouldn't the line above also change to make the `value` argument no longer optional? Doing so would accurately distinguish between the "has a single argument" and "has no argument" overloads, which have different return types.
Good point - yes, I believe you are correct
I'm guessing some of these changes are like prettier changes?
Yes sorry, I have prettier with format on save enabled. You want me to revert these?
Oh no. I like prettier being run on the code!
